page.title: 08Mum's Day (Mrs A.G.Campbell)
page.content: I awoke this morning at 7 a.m.Peeping through the curtains I saw a soft haze over the Green in front of our house,a strong indication that at last we may be in for a long overdue summery,warm day.After slipping into my dressing gown I sleepily descend the stairs, fill the kettle & reach out for the breakfast Cereals.Dad has long since left for work so the three of us have our Breakfast & prepare to leave for School.We are picked up by Nan & Grand- -ad as it is Ascension Day & they are going to Mass.We shall miss our usual walk via the much loved railway path. We say our goodbyes at the top of the School Drive & go our separate ways, albeit we shall all be at Mass together.After Mass I go & buy food in for the weekend from the local Super- -market,which is all hustle & bustle.
